name: df-dm
params: setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0
body: |- wceq(cdm(c0), cab(s0, wex(s1, wbr(cv(s0), c0, cv(s1)))))
comment: Define the domain of a class. Definition 3 of [Suppes] p. 59. For example, ` F = { <. 2 , 6 >. , <. 3 , 9 >. } -> dom F = { 2 , 3 } ` ( ~ ex-dm ). Another example is the domain of the complex arctangent, ` ( A e. dom arctan <-> ( A e. CC /\ A =/= -u _i /\ A =/= _i ) ) ` (for proof see ~ atandm ). Contrast with range (defined in ~ df-rn ). For alternate definitions see ~ dfdm2 , ~ dfdm3 , and ~ dfdm4 . The notation " ` dom ` " is used by Enderton; other authors sometimes use script D. (Contributed by NM, 1-Aug-1994.)
